attributes.action: reject the proposal to create a unitary North Yorkshire County Council
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: North Yorkshire County Council proposes to create a single unitary authority for the county.   The Council would be the largest administrative area in England and only Birmingham and Leeds City Councils would have larger populations.   The new Council would be extremely remote for most of its residents.   The proposals would be bad for local democracy, bad for local services and bad for the local economy.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "reject the proposal to create a unitary North Yorkshire County Council."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12958.asp

Prime Minister's Office
